poem:
Title: "Politics in Pencil Skirts and Suits"

Keir Starmer, verbose and proud,
staining my morning with political cloud.
A request in ink, printed on faceless news - 
"Get Him Out to Help Out" fresh in the morning dew.
Isabella echoes, evening-fed on campaign blues.
Oh, the reality in your morning brew. 

Echoes of a democracy, quiet yet loud,
Is this politics, or just a stationary plough?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "An election slogan to help Keir Starmer keep it simple | Brief letters I am already bored by Keir Starmer’s overly verbose pronouncements. Might I suggest that Labour adopts a simple slogan and image combo that we can all get behind – a cartoon of Rishi Sunak with the words: “Get Him Out to Help Out”.Julian JordonBroughton-in-Furness, Cumbria • Isabella Stone said she was already fed up with the election campaign at 6.30pm on Wednesday". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: An election slogan to help Keir Starmer keep it simple | Brief letters I am already bored by Keir Starmer’s overly verbose pronouncements. Might I suggest that Labour adopts a simple slogan and image combo that we can all get behind – a cartoon of Rishi Sunak with the words: “Get Him Out to Help Out”.Julian JordonBroughton-in-Furness, Cumbria • Isabella Stone said she was already fed up with the election campaign at 6.30pm on Wednesday
